Package pl.lib.automation

Class AutomatedReportService

java.lang.Object
pl.lib.automation.AutomatedReportService
public class AutomatedReportService extends Object
Service for automated report generation from JSON data.

This class serves as the main entry point to the library, offering high-level methods for generating PDF reports directly from JSON data and report configuration.

The service internally uses JsonReportGenerator for data processing and JasperReports structure generation.

Main functionalities:

  • PDF report generation from JSON
  • Subreports and groups support
  • Optional JRXML output for debugging
  • Returning JasperPrint objects for further processing

Usage example:


 // JSON data as String
 String jsonData = "[{\"name\":\"Product 1\",\"price\":100.50}]";

 // Report configuration
 ReportConfig config = new ReportConfig.Builder()
     .title("Products Report")
     .addColumn(ColumnDefinition.builder("name").header("Product Name").build())
     .addColumn(ColumnDefinition.builder("price").header("Price").format("#,##0.00").build())
     .build();

 // Generate report
 AutomatedReportService service = new AutomatedReportService();
 service.generatePdfReportFromJson(jsonData, config, "report.pdf");
Since:
1.0

  • Method Details

    • generatePdfReportFromJson

      public void generatePdfReportFromJson(String jsonContent, ReportConfig config, String outputPath) throws net.sf.jasperreports.engine.JRException, IOException
      Generates PDF report from JSON data and saves to file.

      The method processes JSON data according to the provided configuration and exports the resulting report directly to a PDF file.

      Parameters:
      jsonContent - source data in JSON format (must be an array of objects)
      config - report configuration defining columns, groups and formatting
      outputPath - path to output PDF file
      Throws:
      net.sf.jasperreports.engine.JRException - in case of compilation or report generation errors
      IOException - in case of file write errors
      IllegalArgumentException - if jsonContent is not a valid JSON array

    • generatePdfReportFromJsonWithJrxml

      public void generatePdfReportFromJsonWithJrxml(String jsonContent, ReportConfig config, String outputPath) throws net.sf.jasperreports.engine.JRException, IOException
      Generates PDF report from JSON data with JRXML debugging option.

      Similar to generatePdfReportFromJson(String, ReportConfig, String), but additionally prints the generated JRXML code to console for debugging purposes.

      Parameters:
      jsonContent - source data in JSON format (must be an array of objects)
      config - report configuration defining columns, groups and formatting
      outputPath - path to output PDF file
      Throws:
      net.sf.jasperreports.engine.JRException - in case of compilation or report generation errors
      IOException - in case of file write errors
      IllegalArgumentException - if jsonContent is not a valid JSON array

    • generateReportFromJson

      public net.sf.jasperreports.engine.JasperPrint generateReportFromJson(String jsonContent, ReportConfig config) throws net.sf.jasperreports.engine.JRException, IOException
      Generates JasperPrint object from JSON data for further processing.

      The method returns a JasperPrint object instead of saving the report to file, which allows for further processing or export in different formats.

      Parameters:
      jsonContent - source data in JSON format (must be an array of objects)
      config - report configuration defining columns, groups and formatting
      Returns:
      JasperPrint object ready for export in various formats
      Throws:
      net.sf.jasperreports.engine.JRException - in case of compilation or report generation errors
      IOException - in case of JSON parsing errors
      IllegalArgumentException - if jsonContent is not a valid JSON array
